summary: This is an FBI Special Agent's affidavit in support of a search warrant for compact discs seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence on July 7, 2019. The affidavit details evidence found during the search, including discs labeled with references to underage girls, nudes, and Epstein's properties, and incorporates the indictment against Epstein for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The financier accused of sex trafficking and sexually abusing dozens of minor girls at his residences in New York and Florida from at least 2002 to 2005.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: Signed the initial search warrant for the Epstein residence on July 6, 2019, and the subsequent warrant on July 7, 2019.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signed the sealed indictment against Jeffrey Epstein, which is attached as Exhibit A to the affidavit.

connections.description: Epstein directed Employee-1, a New York-based employee, to communicate with victims via phone to arrange sexual encounters at the New York residence.
Epstein arranged for Employee-2 to contact minor victims in Florida to schedule encounters at his Palm Beach residence prior to his travel.
Employee-3 placed phone calls to minor victims, including Minor Victim-3, to schedule appointments for sexual encounters with Epstein.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-1 repeatedly at the New York residence from around 2002, paid her, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-2 repeatedly at the Palm Beach residence from around 2004, paid her, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-3 repeatedly at the Palm Beach residence from around 2005, paid her, asked her age, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.

events.title: Grand Jury Indictment of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Jeffrey Epstein with sex trafficking of minors and sex trafficking conspiracy.

events.title: First Search Warrant Execution
events.description: Law enforcement began executing a search warrant at Epstein's New York residence but stopped to seek a new warrant after initial observations.

events.title: Second Search Warrant Execution and Seizure
events.description: Law enforcement resumed and completed the search of Epstein's New York residence under a new warrant, seizing numerous compact discs, binders of photographs, and other evidence from safes, dressers, and closets.

events.title: Beginning of Alleged Abuse Pattern
events.description: The indictment alleges Jeffrey Epstein began sexually exploiting and abusing dozens of minor girls at his New York and Florida residences from at least this year.

events.title: Scheduling of Abuse via Employees
events.description: Employee-1 called Minor Victim-1 to schedule a paid sexual encounter with Epstein. Employee-2 called Minor Victim-2 for the same purpose.

events.title: Continued Abuse and Recruitment
events.description: Employee-2 and Employee-3 placed calls to Minor Victim-3 to schedule paid sexual encounters with Epstein at the Palm Beach residence.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY (Epstein Residence / New York Residence)
Zorro Ranch (Epstein's property in New Mexico)
Little Saint James (Epstein's property in the U.S. Virgin Islands)
keyFacts: During a search on July 6-7, 2019, FBI agents seized dozens of compact discs from Epstein's New York safe and dresser, with labels including 'Young [Name]', 'Nudes 00-24', 'Girl Pics Nude', 'Thai Massage', and female names.
The search also revealed nude and sexually suggestive Polaroid photographs of young females who appeared to be teenagers, stored in a dresser drawer with a folder marked with a girl's name.

The affidavit details a victim's (Victim-1) corroborated account of the interior of Epstein's residence, including a massage room with artwork of naked women, a bathroom with a torso bust, and a taxidermied dog.
The incorporated indictment alleges Epstein operated a network where he paid victim-recruiters to bring him new minor girls for sexual abuse in both New York and Florida.

The warrant application seeks explicit authorization to search the seized discs for evidence of child exploitation, noting the investigation is ongoing and the search of the media was anticipated to begin the night of July 7, 2019.
